g4201.definition: [Πόρκιος] of Latin origin; apparently swinish; Porcius, a Roman

g4202.definition: [πορνεία] from {{g4203}}; harlotry (including adultery and incest); figuratively, idolatry

g4203.definition: [πορνεύω] from {{g4204}}; to act the harlot, i.e. (literally) indulge unlawful lust (of either sex), or (figuratively) practise idolatry

g4204.definition: [πόρνη] feminine of {{g4205}}; a strumpet; figuratively, an idolater

g4205.definition: [πόρνος] from πέρνημι (to sell; akin to the base of {{g4097}}); a (male) prostitute (as venal), i.e. (by analogy) a debauchee (libertine)

g4206.definition: [πόῤῥω] adverb from {{g4253}}; forwards, i.e. at a distance See also {{g4207}}.

g4207.definition: [πόῤῥωθεν] from {{g4206}} with adverbial enclitic of source; from far, or (by implication) at a distance, i.e. distantly

g4208.definition: [ποῤῥωτέρω] adverb comparative of {{g4206}}; further, i.e. a greater distance

g4209.definition: [πορφύρα] of Latin origin; the "purple" mussel, i.e. (by implication) the red-blue color itself, and finally a garment dyed with it

g4211.definition: [πορφυρόπωλις] feminine of a compound of {{g4209}} and {{g4453}}; a female trader in purple cloth

g4213.definition: [πόσις] from the alternate of {{g4095}}; a drinking (the act), i.e. (concretely) a draught

g4214.definition: [πόσος] from an absolute πός (who, what) and {{g3739}}; interrogative pronoun (of amount) how much (large, long or (plural) many)

g4215.definition: [ποταμός] probably from a derivative of the alternate of {{g4095}} (compare {{g4224}}); a current, brook or freshet (as drinkable), i.e. running water

g4216.definition: [ποταμοφόρητος] from {{g4215}} and a derivative of {{g5409}}; river-borne, i.e. overwhelmed by a stream

g4217.definition: [ποταπός] apparently from {{g4219}} and the base of {{g4226}}; interrogatively, whatever, i.e. of what possible sort

g4218.definition: [ποτέ] from the base of {{g4225}} and {{g5037}}; indefinite adverb, at some time, ever

g4219.definition: [πότε] from the base of {{g4226}} and {{g5037}}; interrogative adverb, at what time

g4220.definition: [πότερον] neuter of a comparative of the base of {{g4226}}; interrogative as adverb, which (of two), i.e. is it this or that

g4221.definition: [ποτήριον] neuter of a derivative of the alternate of {{g4095}}; a drinking-vessel; by extension, the contents thereof, i.e. a cupful (draught); figuratively, a lot or fate

g4222.definition: [ποτίζω] from a derivative of the alternate of {{g4095}}; to furnish drink, irrigate

g4223.definition: [Ποτίολοι] of Latin origin; little wells, i.e. mineral springs; Potioli (i.e. Puteoli), a place in Italy

g4224.definition: [πότος] from the alternate of {{g4095}}; a drinking-bout or carousal

g4225.definition: [πού] genitive case of an indefinite pronoun πός (some) otherwise obsolete (compare {{g4214}}); as adverb of place, somewhere, i.e. nearly

g4226.definition: [ποῦ] genitive case of an interrogative pronoun πός (what) otherwise obsolete (perhaps the same as {{g4225}} used with the rising slide of inquiry); as adverb of place; at (by implication, to) what locality

g4227.definition: [Πούδης] of Latin origin; modest; Pudes (i.e. Pudens), a Christian

g4228.definition: [πούς] a primary word; a "foot" (figuratively or literally)

g4229.definition: [πρᾶγμα] from {{g4238}}; a deed; by implication, an affair; by extension, an object (material)

g4231.definition: [πραγματεύομαι] from {{g4229}}; to busy oneself with, i.e. to trade

g4232.definition: [πραιτώριον] of Latin origin; the prætorium or governor's courtroom (sometimes including the whole edifice and camp)

g4233.definition: [πράκτωρ] from a derivative of {{g4238}}; a practiser, i.e. (specially), an official collector

g4234.definition: [πρᾶξις] from {{g4238}}; practice, i.e. (concretely) an act; by extension, a function

g4235.definition: [πρᾷος] a form of {{g4239}}, used in certain parts; gentle, i.e. humble

g4237.definition: [πρασιά] perhaps from πράσον (a leek, and so an onion-patch); a garden plot, i.e. (by implication, of regular beds) a row (repeated in plural by Hebraism, to indicate an arrangement)

g4238.definition: [πράσσω] a primary verb; to "practise", i.e. perform repeatedly or habitually (thus differing from {{g4160}}, which properly refers to a single act); by implication, to execute, accomplish, etc.; specially, to collect (dues), fare (personally)

g4239.definition: [πραΰς] apparently a primary word; mild, i.e. (by implication) humble See also {{g4235}}.

g4241.definition: [πρέπω] apparently a primary verb; to tower up (be conspicuous), i.e. (by implication) to be suitable or proper (third person singular present indicative, often used impersonally, it is fit or right)

g4242.definition: [πρεσβεία] from {{g4243}}; seniority (eldership), i.e. (by implication) an embassy (concretely, ambassadors)

g4243.definition: [πρεσβεύω] from the base of {{g4245}}; to be a senior, i.e. (by implication) act as a representative (figuratively, preacher)

g4244.definition: [πρεσβυτέριον] neuter of a presumed derivative of {{g4245}}; the order of elders, i.e. (specially), Israelite Sanhedrin or Christian "presbytery"

g4245.definition: [πρεσβύτερος] comparative of πρέσβυς (elderly); older; as noun, a senior; specially, an Israelite Sanhedrist (also figuratively, member of the celestial council) or Christian "presbyter"

g4246.definition: [πρεσβύτης] from the same as {{g4245}}; an old man

g4248.definition: [πρηνής] from {{g4253}}; leaning (falling) forward ("prone"), i.e. head foremost

g4249.definition: [πρίζω] a strengthened form of a primary prio (to saw); to saw in two

g4251.definition: [Πρίσκα] of Latin origin; feminine of Priscus, ancient; Priska, a Christian woman See also {{g4252}}.

g4252.definition: [Πρίσκιλλα] diminutive of {{g4251}}; Priscilla (i.e. little Prisca), a Christian woman

g4253.definition: [πρό] a primary preposition; "fore", i.e. in front of, prior (figuratively, superior) to In the comparative, it retains the same significations.

g4254.definition: [προάγω] from {{g4253}} and {{g71}}; to lead forward (magisterially); intransitively, to precede (in place or time (participle, previous))

g4255.definition: [προαιρέομαι] from {{g4253}} and {{g138}}; to choose for oneself before another thing (prefer), i.e. (by implication) to propose (intend)

g4256.definition: [προαιτιάομαι] from {{g4253}} and a derivative of {{g156}}; to accuse already, i.e. previously charge

g4257.definition: [προακούω] from {{g4253}} and {{g191}}; to hear already,i.e. anticipate

g4258.definition: [προαμαρτάνω] from {{g4253}} and {{g264}}; to sin previously (to conversion)

g4259.definition: [προαύλιον] neuter of a presumed compound of {{g4253}} and {{g833}}; a forecourt, i.e. vestibule (alley-way)

g4260.definition: [προβαίνω] from {{g4253}} and the base of {{g939}}; to walk forward, i.e. advance (literally, or in years)

g4261.definition: [προβάλλω] from {{g4253}} and {{g906}}; to throw forward, i.e. push to the front, germinate

g4262.definition: [προβατικός] from {{g4263}}; relating to sheep, i.e. (a gate) through which they were led into Jerusalem

g4263.definition: [πρόβατον] probably neuter of a presumed derivative of {{g4260}}; something that walks forward (a quadruped), i.e. (specially), a sheep (literally or figuratively)

g4264.definition: [προβιβάζω] from {{g4253}} and a reduplicated form of {{g971}}; to force forward, i.e. bring to the front, instigate

g4265.definition: [προβλέπω] from {{g4253}} and {{g991}}; to look out beforehand, i.e. furnish in advance

g4266.definition: [προγίνομαι] from {{g4253}} and {{g1096}}; to be already, i.e. have previousy transpired

g4267.definition: [προγινώσκω] from {{g4253}} and {{g1097}}; to know beforehand, i.e. foresee

g4270.definition: [προγράφω] from {{g4253}} and {{g1125}}; to write previously; figuratively, to announce, prescribe

g4271.definition: [πρόδηλος] from {{g4253}} and {{g1212}}; plain before all men, i.e. obvious

g4272.definition: [προδίδωμι] from {{g4253}} and {{g1325}}; to give before the other party has given

g4273.definition: [προδότης] from {{g4272}} (in the sense of giving forward into another's (the enemy's) hands); a surrender

g4274.definition: [πρόδρομος] from the alternate of {{g4390}}; a runner ahead, i.e. scout (figuratively, precursor)

g4276.definition: [προελπίζω] from {{g4253}} and {{g1679}}; to hope in advance of other confirmation

g4277.definition: [προέπω] from {{g4253}} and {{g2036}}; to say already, to predict Compare {{g4280}}.

g4279.definition: [προεπαγγέλλομαι] middle voice from {{g4253}} and {{g1861}}; to promise of old

g4280.definition: [προερέω] from {{g4253}} and {{g2046}}; used as alternate of {{g4277}}; to say already, predict

g4281.definition: [προέρχομαι] from {{g4253}} and {{g2064}} (including its alternate); to go onward, precede (in place or time)

g4282.definition: [προετοιμάζω] from {{g4253}} and {{g2090}}; to fit up in advance (literally or figuratively)

g4283.definition: [προευαγγελίζομαι] middle voice from {{g4253}} and {{g2097}}; to announce glad news in advance

g4284.definition: [προέχομαι] middle voice from {{g4253}} and {{g2192}}; to hold oneself before others, i.e. (figuratively) to excel

g4285.definition: [προηγέομαι] from {{g4253}} and {{g2233}}; to lead the way for others, i.e. show deference

g4286.definition: [πρόθεσις] from {{g4388}}; a setting forth, i.e. (figuratively) proposal (intention); specially, the show-bread (in the Temple) as exposed before God

g4287.definition: [προθέσμιος] from {{g4253}} and a derivative of {{g5087}}; fixed beforehand, i.e. (feminine with {{g2250}} implied) a designated day

g4289.definition: [πρόθυμος] from {{g4253}} and {{g2372}}; forward in spirit, i.e. predisposed; neuter (as noun) alacrity

g4291.definition: [προΐστημι] from {{g4253}} and {{g2476}}; to stand before, i.e. (in rank) to preside, or (by implication) to practise

g4292.definition: [προκαλέομαι] middle voice from {{g4253}} and {{g2564}}; to call forth to oneself (challenge), i.e. (by implication) to irritate

g4293.definition: [προκαταγγέλλω] from {{g4253}} and {{g2605}}; to anounce beforehand, i.e. predict, promise

g4294.definition: [προκαταρτίζω] from {{g4253}} and {{g2675}}; to prepare in advance

g4295.definition: [πρόκειμαι] from {{g4253}} and {{g2749}}; to lie before the view, i.e. (figuratively) to be present (to the mind), to stand forth (as an example or reward)

g4296.definition: [προκηρύσσω] from {{g4253}} and {{g2784}}; to herald (i.e. proclaim) in advance

g4297.definition: [προκοπή] from {{g4298}}; progress, i.e. advancement (subjectively or objectively)

g4298.definition: [προκόπτω] from {{g4253}} and {{g2875}}; to drive forward (as if by beating), i.e. (figuratively and intransitively) to advance (in amount, to grow; in time, to be well along)

g4299.definition: [πρόκριμα] from a compound of {{g4253}} and {{g2919}}; a prejudgment (prejudice), i.e. prepossession
